learning_outcomes.description: Identify the major anatomical structures of the head and neck and relate these to their function.
Identify the anatomy and histology of structures within and around the oral cavity, including their clinical appearance.
Describe the anatomical structures of the orofacial region, as relate to the normal function of the mouth and associated structures.
Label the histological and radiographic features of structures of the orofacial region.
Understand the embryology and histology of tooth development and patterns of tooth eruption.
Describe the anatomy of the permanent and primary dentition, using correct terminology.
Differentiate between normal and abnormal features with respect to structures of the oro-facial region.
Describe the role of microbes and saliva in the oral environment, in health and common dental diseases and conditions.

assessments.assessment_title: Tooth Morphology, Eruption Timings, and Notation Exam
assessments.task_description: This assessment takes the form of a written exam during a scheduled DENT7101 session. It might consist of a mix of multiple-choice, true/false, matching, labelling, and short answer questions. The examination will run for 60 minutes. Certain components of this exam may involve the identification of extracted natural teeth, which must be handled under strict infection control protocols.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: This practical test consists of multiple-choice and short answer questions covering the following course content. Topics for this practical test may include: • Anatomy, Embryology & histology of the head and neck • Structure of the head and neck: bones & muscles • Structure of the head and neck: nerves & vessels • Salivary glands & composition •Anatomy, Embryology & histology of the oral cavity • Structure of the oral cavity
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: For this task, you are required to select a problem (or problems) from the hypothetical case scenarios provided during the course and develop descriptive and evaluative responses. Ensure that your responses follow the structured format introduced during the course. Submit your completed work through the ePortfolio system.

assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This 120-minute exam consists of multiple-choice, short answer and problem-solving questions covering all course content.
